roleset.name: to cause or allow to flow
roleset.note: SPILL-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of VNcls pour-9.5, substance_emission-43.4. This roleset conflates agent and source, which VN separates. (from spill.01-v)

example.name: all arguments
example.text: On July 2 , 1987 , the tanker S.S. Glacier Bay struck a rock and spilled almost 150,000 gallons of oil into the Cook Inlet .

example.name: transitive with adverbials
example.text: Arkansas Democrat David Pryor spilled his guts on the Senate floor the other day after he 'd joined the Finance Committee 's early-morning pork-barrel revels : `` I must tell you ...
example.arg: after he 'd joined the Finance Committee 's early-morning pork-barrel revels

example.name: One of the best sentences ever.
example.text: The rich nuances that suffuse this roll call are seen in the timeless distinction between a schlemiel ` clumsy jerk ' and a schlimazel ` habitual loser ' : the schlemiel inevitably trips and spills his hot soup ? all over the schlimazel .

example.name: both arguments
example.text: [The same issue]-2 threatens [*-2]to spill over to the foreign aid debate , and Mr. Bush also is threatening [*-3] to veto any agreement that [*T*-1] preserves Senate-passed provisions renewing U.S. support for the United Nations Fund for Population Activities .

example.name: with direction
example.text: Come daybreak , eight family members and two other workers unroll a sheet of raw rubber that-1 [*T*-1] covers the floor of the house and spills out onto the street .
